alert.note: Alert for Haines Borough and Klukwan; Municipality of Skagway (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 20 at 11:21AM AKDT by NWS Juneau
info.description: ...RIVER RISES DUE TO MELTING SNOWPACK... UNSEASONABLY WARM TEMPERATURES ACROSS THE NORTHERN PANHANDLE OVER THE PAST SEVERAL DAYS HAS RESULTED IN EXCESSIVE SNOWMELT AT HIGHER ELEVATIONS. AS A RESULT, WATER LEVELS IN RIVERS AND STREAMS THAT HAVE THEIR ORIGINS IN THE MOUNTAINS HAVE BEEN RISING SINCE THIS PAST SUNDAY AND CONTINUE TO RISE TODAY. GREATEST RATES OF RISE ARE OCCURRING FROM LATE EVENING TO EARLY MORNING. WITH ONE MORE DAY OF VERY WARM DAYTIME HIGHS, RIVERS AND STREAMS ARE EXPECTED TO RISE ONCE AGAIN THIS EVENING AND MAY APPROACH BANKFULL LEVELS. THERE IS A GREAT DEAL OF UNCERTAINTY REGARDING EXACTLY HOW HIGH THE TAIYA AND CHILKAT RIVERS WILL RISE, AS THE REMAINING AMOUNT OF HIGH ELEVATION SNOWPACK IS UNKNOWN. A HYDROLOGIC ADVISORY IS ISSUED WHEN SIGNIFICANT RIVER RISES ARE EXPECTED OR OCCURRING, BUT FLOOD IS NOT EXPECTED. THIS STATEMENT WILL BE UPDATED AS REQUIRED OR WHEN NEW INFORMATION IS AVAILABLE. FOR CHILKAT RIVER AT KLUKWAN: AT 10:00AM THE STAGE WAS 125.47 FEET. FLOOD STAGE IS 128.0 FEET. FORECAST: A CREST AROUND 125.63 FEET IS EXPECTED AROUND 10:00AM WEDNESDAY. ... FOR KLEHINI R NR KLUKWAN: AT 10:00AM THE STAGE WAS 77.77 FEET. ... FOR SKAGWAY POWER: AT 10:41AM THE STAGE WAS 20.36 FEET. FLOOD STAGE IS 26.5 FEET. FORECAST: A CREST AROUND 21.46 FEET IS EXPECTED AROUND 10:00PM TUESDAY. ... FOR TAIYA RIVER NEAR SKAGWAY: AT 10:00AM THE STAGE WAS 15.38 FEET. FLOOD STAGE IS 16.5 FEET. FORECAST: A CREST AROUND 15.75 FEET IS EXPECTED AROUND 4:00AM WEDNESDAY. ... FOR WEST CREEK NEAR SKAGWAY: AT 10:00AM THE STAGE WAS 16.95 FEET. FLOOD STAGE IS 26.5 FEET.
